body:
Comment 1: 
Unfortunately the regexp semantics change from regexp to exp/regexp.
Fortunately, they are now more in line with the regexp behavior in
the Perl regexp family tree.  One of the differences is that the old
regexp allowed '.' to match a newline character, while exp/regexp
by default does not (nor do Perl and its progeny) To allow '.' to 
match newline, begin the regexp by turning on the 's' flag:

`(?s)^(.*)$`
_Owner changed to @rsc._ _Status changed to **Unfortunate**._
